column3: Mischief was taken into the kitchen to live
column4: and a happier dog than he could not be imagined
column5: trotting about after the cook and housemaid from morning until night
column8: attending to all the mischief that came in his way.One day
column9: about two weeks after he came into the house to live
column10: a letter came from Milwaukee saying that he
column12: must be sent off. And of course
column13: Mischief knew about it. How could he help it
column14: when the whole household were so sorry to have him go? And accordingly he began to make ready for the long journey he was so soon to take.As he sat by the range
column15: evidently trying to make up his mind what to take with him
column16: his first thought was of the old coat he had had as a bed; so he crossed the room
column17: took the coat in his mouth
column18: and with his paws scratched it up into a bundle.
